title: How to Add Someone from Another Country on WhatsApp on Android

steps.title: Open your Android’s Contacts.
steps.content: Open your Android’s Contacts. Look for an app called "Contacts" in your app drawer. It’s usually a blue, red, or orange icon with a white outline of a person’s head. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the new contact icon.
steps.content: Tap the new contact icon. It's usually a plus (+) sign. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select a storage location.
steps.content: Select a storage location. Depending on your contacts app, you'll usually be asked to select an account and/or a storage location (internal storage or SIM card). This is where WhatsApp will save your new contact.

steps.title: Type a name for the contact.
steps.content: Type a name for the contact.

steps.title: Enter the contact’s international phone number.
steps.content: Enter the contact’s international phone number. In the phone number blank, start by typing the “+” (plus) symbol, followed by the country code (e.g., 44 for UK), and then the rest of the person's phone number. [3] X Research source For example, a UK phone number would look something like this: +447981555555. Phone numbers in Mexico must have a 1 after the country code (+52). Phone numbers in Argentina (country code +54) must have a 9 between the country code and the area code. Remove the "15" prefix from this number so the phone number has 13 digits.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . The location varies by version. Your contact is now added to your Android’s phone book, which means you can now chat with them in WhatsApp. [4] X Research source
